title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A, the response must identify the First Amendment clause that is common to both Wisconsin v. Yoder (1972) and Cantwell v. Connecticut (1940).

For Task B, the response must explain how the facts in Wisconsin v. Yoder and Cantwell v. Connecticut resulted in the Supreme Court issuing similar holdings in both cases. The response for Task B may earn up to two points.

To earn one point for Task B, the response must describe relevant information (facts or holding) about the required Supreme Court case

OR

To earn two points for Task B, the response must explain how the facts in both cases resulted in the Supreme Court issuing similar holdings.

For Task C, the response must correctly explain how the facts of Cantwell v. Connecticut (1940) illustrate the Courtâ€™s need to balance government power and the rights of citizens.

Points for Task A, Task B, and Task C are earned independently.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the prompt.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the prompt.
The response accomplishes two of Task A, Task B, or Task C or just take two in Task B.
The response accomplishes Task A, Task B (1 point), and Task C, or Task A and Task B (2 points) or Task B (2 points) and Task C.
The response accomplishes all available points in all tasks.
